page.title: 03Local History
page.content: { John Abel 1577-1674} John Abel was born and buried in Sarnesfield having designed his own tomb which is situated west of the porch.He was appointed{Kings Carpenter in the siege of Hereford during the civil war by Charles I.He designed Sarnesfield church and then built it.On his tomb is written: {This craggy stone a covering is for { an architect's bed {That lofty building raised high yet { now lyes low his head { His line and rule so death { concludes are locked up in a store { Build they who list or they who { wist,for he can build no more { His house of day could hold no { longer } {May heaven's joy frame him a { stronger }
